citations.narrative:
The record of animals on hand has not been updated to reflect a hamster removed from the premises. According to the
facility representative, the hamster was transferred out of the facility to a different location. However, the record of animals
on hand still shows a hamster being present on the property. Accurate records disclosing the acquisition or disposition of
animals on the property is necessary for accountability and identification of animals during inspection and for performing
trace back of animals during a disease outbreak. Correct by March 17, 2023 by ensuring that the record of animals on
hand accurately accounts for all animals purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, leased or otherwise in your
possession or which is transported, sold, euthanized, or otherwise disposed of. Records must include any offspring born
of any animals while in your possession.

The metal bars of two enclosures housing rabbits have large quantities of rust and peeling of the metal coating. The
enclosures are comprised of a solid plastic base with a metal wire top and sides. The metal wires have pieces of white
coating flaking off which is easily removed by a finger during inspection. The rest of the exposed wire is rough and
covered in rust which was also easily removed during inspection. Severely rusted metal wire and wire with flaking coating
can contaminate the enclosure and lead to accidental ingestion by the animals housed within. Additionally, the surface of
the wire becomes uneven and pitted, preventing adequate sanitation to protect the animals from potential illness.
Structural integrity of the wire can be compromised with extreme rust. Correct by March 21, 2023 by ensuring that all
enclosures are maintained in good repair to protect the rabbits from injury, are structurally sound, and can be sanitized in
accordance with 3.56(b)(1).
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
End Section
